subject: Fashion
title: Worth the First Couturier
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Worth the First Couturier.

hook.text: Before Charles Worth, dressmakers were invisible servants. He turned fashion design into art.

buildup.text: In the 1850s, Worth opened a salon in Paris where he showed pre-made designs to wealthy clients.

discovery.text: He was the first designer to sew his label into garments. The brand-name concept was born.

twist.text: Worth was English, not French. The founder of Parisian haute couture was a foreigner.

climax.text: He dressed Empress EugÃ©nie and created the fashion system we still use: seasonal shows and labels.

punchline.text: One Englishman in Paris invented the fashion industry.

quiz.question: What did Charles Worth pioneer in the fashion industry?
options: The concept of designer labels and pre-made seasonal collections
Mass-produced clothing for the working class
